## Related Issues
<!---

This uses blobstore from https://github.com/WebAssembly/wasi-blobstore/pull/25 for blobby

Bumps [hyper-util](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper-util) from 0.1.8 to 0.1.9.
Release notes

Sourced from hyper-util's releases.

v0.1.9

What's Changed

  • Add support for client::legacy DNS resolvers to set non-zero ports on returned addresses.
  • Fix client::legacy wrongly retrying pooled connections that were created successfully but failed immediately after, resulting in a retry loop.

New Contributors

  • @​Nuhvi made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper-util#148

candidates.title: chore: wash Go wasip2 support
candidates.body:
Fixes https://github.com/wasmCloud/wasmCloud/issues/3049

tinygo wasi p2 automatically embeds wits and there is no way to disable this behaviour.

This PR:
- Extracts the wasip1 -> wasip2  adaptation step into a function
- Splits the Go component compilation path into 2 routes: wasip1 and wasip2
- wasip1: Compile, adapt to p2, embed wit world
- wasip2: Compile only
- Keeps the `rust` path doing wasip1 -> p2 adaption


🚨  Our existing examples will fail compilation as they specify `wasm32-wasi-preview2` even tho they are actually `wasm32-wasi-preview1`.
We can fix that in 2 ways:
1.  Update the examples' `wasmcloud.toml` to `wasm32-wasi-preview1`
2. Update the examples' actual code to be wasi-preview2 compatible

Personally leaning towards 1. so we can release `wash` and review all Go examples right after, migrating them to wasi p2.

Release notes

Sourced from rustls-native-certs's releases.

v/0.8.0

Breaking changes

  • load_native_certs() now returns a CertificateResult value containing all the certificates that were successfully found as well as any errors encountered. Changes made in 0.7.1 in order to find certificates in more locations resulted in new errors in scenarios that previously worked for most users. This change allows callers to determine the error handling strategy most appropriate to their application.

candidates.title: chore: Replace dirs dependency with home
candidates.body:
## Feature or Problem

Since we're depending on [`dirs`](https://crates.io/crates/dirs) for very minimal set of functionality, and there are some [potential complications with the dependencies](https://github.com/dirs-dev/dirs-sys-rs/issues/21#issuecomment-1531528155), it seems to me that the prudent thing for us to do would be to make use of the ubiquitous [`home`](https://crates.io/crates/home) crate instead.

This replaces all of our use of `dirs` (minus the indirect dependency from `testcontainers`, that I'm hoping to address in/via https://github.com/testcontainers/testcontainers-rs/pull/736).

candidates.title: feat: Provide predefined testcontainers
candidates.body:
## Feature or Problem

To make it easier to test consistently against the same versions of software (and have the flexibility to change the version to different one with ease as needed), we should provide a set of predefined testcontainers that can be used across the various crates in this repository as well as pulled in by external projects as well.

This also consolidates the existing usage of testcontainers across the repository to switching them to the ones under `wasmcloud_test_util` instead.

candidates.title: chore: Switch oci-distribution to oci feature
candidates.body:

It also switches the crates depending on this functionality to use the new feature.
